revised_title: Biochemical Analysis of Cell-Wall Composition in Apical Meristem of Stem and Root
tldr: The study investigates the biochemical composition of the cell walls in the apical meristem of stem and root in plants. It reveals that root meristem walls contain a higher proportion of protein and fatty acids, while stem meristem walls have more cellulose and pectic substances. These differences affect the diffusion of water-soluble solutes through the meristem wall, contributing to the distinct growth patterns of roots and stems.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
